This is a minimal example of using the bookdown package to write a book. The output format for this example is bookdown::gitbook. [...] This is a reworking of the book Common statistical tests are linear models (or: how to teach stats), written by Jonas Lindel√∏v. The book beautifully demonstrates how many common statistical tests (such as the t-test, ANOVA and chi-squared) are special cases of the linear model. The book also demonstrates that many non-parametric tests, which are needed when certain test assumptions do not hold, can be approximated by linear models using the rank of values. ...
